segment.source: Windows Deployment Options
segment.target: Windows Deployment Options

segment.source: Windows Deployment Options
segment.target: Windows Deployment Options

segment.source: Windows Deployment Options
segment.target: Windows Deployment Options

segment.source: These topics describe additional Windows deployment options and customization scenarios.
segment.target: These topics describe additional Windows deployment options and customization scenarios.

segment.source: In This Section
segment.target: In This Section

segment.source: UEFI Firmware
segment.target: UEFI Firmware

segment.source: Describes considerations for deploying to computers that are based on the Unified Extensible Firmware Interface (UEFI).
segment.target: Describes considerations for deploying to computers that are based on the Unified Extensible Firmware Interface (UEFI).

segment.source: Hard Drives and Partitions
segment.target: Hard Drives and Partitions

segment.source: Describes methods to deploy different drive configurations, including hard drives, solid-state drives (SSDs), and virtual hard drives (VHDs).
segment.target: Describes methods to deploy different drive configurations, including hard drives, solid-state drives (SSDs), and virtual hard drives (VHDs).

segment.source: Deploy Windows on a VHD (Native Boot)
segment.target: Deploy Windows on a VHD (Native Boot)

segment.source: Describes how to create and deploy Windows using virtual hard disks (VHDs).
segment.target: Describes how to create and deploy Windows using virtual hard disks (VHDs).

segment.source: Configure Network Settings in an Unattended Installation
segment.target: Configure Network Settings in an Unattended Installation

segment.source: Describes common networking scenarios and how to implement them in unattended installations.
segment.target: Describes common networking scenarios and how to implement them in unattended installations.

segment.source: Device Drivers and Deployment Overview
segment.target: Device Drivers and Deployment Overview

segment.source: Describes methods of adding and configuring device drivers.
segment.target: Describes methods of adding and configuring device drivers.

segment.source: Language Packs (lp.cab) and Windows Deployment
segment.target: Language Packs (lp.cab) and Windows Deployment

segment.source: Describes methods of adding language packs and language interface packs (LIPs).
segment.target: Describes methods of adding language packs and language interface packs (LIPs).

segment.source: Configure Oobe.xml
segment.target: Configure Oobe.xml

segment.source: Describes Oobe.xml, which is a content file that is used to collect text and images for customizing Out-Of-Box Experience (OOBE).
segment.target: Describes Oobe.xml, which is a content file that is used to collect text and images for customizing Out-Of-Box Experience (OOBE).

segment.source: Work with Product Keys and Activation
segment.target: Work with Product Keys and Activation

segment.source: Describes how to enter a product key and how to activate Windows.
segment.target: Describes how to enter a product key and how to activate Windows.

segment.source: Battery Life
segment.target: Battery Life

segment.source: Describes methods of managing battery life on different hardware and software platforms.
segment.target: Describes methods of managing battery life on different hardware and software platforms.

segment.source: Understanding Servicing Strategies
segment.target: Understanding Servicing Strategies

segment.source: Describes servicing strategies, including customization during installation, offline servicing, and online servicing (audit mode).
segment.target: Describes servicing strategies, including customization during installation, offline servicing, and online servicing (audit mode).

segment.source: Audit Mode Overview
segment.target: Audit Mode Overview

segment.source: Describes audit mode, which enables you to customize a Windows installation without configuring the user interface pages of OOBE.
segment.target: Describes audit mode, which enables you to customize a Windows installation without configuring the user interface pages of OOBE.

segment.source: Enable and Disable the Built-in Administrator Account
segment.target: Enable and Disable the Built-in Administrator Account

segment.source: Describes how to enable and disable the built-in Administrator account, which helps you run programs and apps as an administrator.
segment.target: Describes how to enable and disable the built-in Administrator account, which helps you run programs and apps as an administrator.

segment.source: Windows Server Deployment Options
segment.target: Windows Server Deployment Options

segment.source: Describes considerations when deploying Windows Server editions.
segment.target: Describes considerations when deploying Windows Server editions.

segment.source: Configure a Trusted Image Identifier for Windows Defender
segment.target: Configure a Trusted Image Identifier for Windows Defender

segment.source: You can speed up the initial performance of your computer for the end user by adding a trusted image identifier to Windows Defender.
segment.target: You can speed up the initial performance of your computer for the end user by adding a trusted image identifier to Windows Defender.

segment.source: Windows Defender is a Microsoft application that can help to prevent, remove, and quarantine malware and spyware.
segment.target: Windows Defender is a Microsoft application that can help to prevent, remove, and quarantine malware and spyware.

segment.source: High DPI Support for IT Professionals
segment.target: High DPI Support for IT Professionals

segment.source: Windows includes features that improve the user experience with premium high density display panels such as 1920x1080 displays that have about 200 DPI and 150% scaling, and 2560x1440 and 3200x1800 displays that have 225-275DPI and 200% scaling.
segment.target: Windows includes features that improve the user experience with premium high density display panels such as 1920x1080 displays that have about 200 DPI and 150% scaling, and 2560x1440 and 3200x1800 displays that have 225-275DPI and 200% scaling.

segment.source: PAE/NX/SSE2 Support Requirement Guide for Windows 8
segment.target: PAE/NX/SSE2 Support Requirement Guide for Windows 8

segment.source: Describes the PAE/NX/SSE2 processor requirements.
segment.target: Describes the PAE/NX/SSE2 processor requirements.

segment.source: Microsoft .NET Framework 3.5 Deployment Considerations
segment.target: Microsoft .NET Framework 3.5 Deployment Considerations

segment.source: Describes how IT Professionals can deploy .NET Framework 3.5 .
segment.target: Describes how IT Professionals can deploy .NET Framework 3.5 .
